titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that a Federal employee may use up to 2 days of sick leave a year in the performance of community service.
To amend title 5, United States Code, to provide that a Federal employee may use up to 2 days of sick leave a year in the performance of community service.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Workforce, Post Office, and the District of Columbia.

bill.summary: Allows federal employees to use up to two days of sick leave per year to perform community service for a charitable organization participating in the Combined Federal Campaign.
